Posts.Content: May 31, 2017 05:20AM Stormborn wrote: Thanks guys, I'm actually a lot calmer today. I put on blaring music and cleaned the house. I think I've been in a state of shock for the last few days and was moving around a lot but getting nothing done. In Ireland the protocol for assessment is straight across the board, the same for all breast clinics in the country and the exact same treatments,waiting times and personnel whether you go public or private and actually I've been researching and apparently you're better off going public so I'm going to take it that my case is less urgent than others and that must be a good sign. Thanks once again for the support x

Posts.Content: May 31, 2017 06:05AM Stormborn wrote: Hi Dj thanks for your reply I have never had any studies done before so have nothing to compare it to. I'm 43 with no BC in my immediate family and here breast check is offered to over 50s. I did have a patch of skin that looked like a mole (but wasn't a mole, I was doing sunbeds at the time and this patch of scaley skin appeared beside the nipple) removed with a few rounds of cryotherapy in that area of my breast approx five years ago, I don't know if that's relevant. I'm fairly positive this lump was not there six weeks ago. I give myself breast exams regularly and have b-cup non dense breasts. This lump is so obvious, I can see clearly that my breasts are different shapes and the one with the lump is heavier, if I bend at the waist it hangs lower. I can feel the lump with my arm if I press my arm to the side, it's not painful but when I press it a certain way it's tender like the feeling of my breasts just before my period. I can't feel any lumps or bumps under my arm. I did have weight loss but went on low carb to lose weight and lost maybe a kg per week. No skin changes, nipple discharge or anything like that. I have noticed that if I lie a certain way in bed my right arm throbs a bit and gets tingly but iv suffered on,and off with carpal tunnel since my pregnancies so put it down to that. I will keep you guys informed and thanks again
Posts.Title: Newbie here, üëã Stormborn djmammo

Posts.Content: Stormborn wrote: Hi guys I'm freaking out a bit here, I found a very obvious lump on upper, outside of rt breast in the shower last Friday. Went straight to my G.P. She did a very thorough breast examination and measured the lump. It's 8cm x 3cm, rock hard and doesn't move. It feels ridgey to me I did a self examination about 6 weeks ago and don't think it was there then but iv lost about a half stone in that time so think maybe with less fat on the breast the lump is more pronounced. My doc has referred my for an urgent triple assessment with the symptomatic breast clinic but could take up to two weeks to get an appointment. Aaaargh I don't know how I'm going to keep calm, my mind is in turmoil. As soon as I felt the lump I got an intense feeling that something was wrong, my whole body shook for about two hours. I have calmed down somewhat but wow this is scary!! Any words of wisdom? Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: May 30, 2017 02:43PM Stormborn wrote: Exactly! I can deal with what I know it's the unknown that I can't deal with. I'm going to ring the clinic tomorrow to see if they can fit me in sooner. On a positive note they do the mammogram, us and biopsy all on the same day here. I just need to find a calm place because if I've learnt anything from reading about other people's experiences it's that it's all a big waiting game, I've never had the gift of patience though. Well done on pushing for an earlier assessment and I hope you won't have to wait too long for the results, did they give you a time frame for biopsy results, I think it's about 10 days here.
